member.name: T:Proton.Parser.Expressions.AssignExpression
member.summary: Represents an assignment expression, such as the "=" operator used to assign values.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.AssignExpression.#ctor(Proton.Lexer.Token)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Validates that the provided token is of type "Assign".
member.param: The token representing the assignment operator ("=").
member.exception: Thrown if the token is not of type "Assign".

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.AssignExpression.ToCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates the string representation of the assignment expression for code generation, including the assignment operator and proper indentation.
member.param: The indentation level (each level equals 4 spaces).
member.returns: A formatted string representing the assignment expression.

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.Expressions.Expression
member.summary: Represents the base class for all expression nodes in the parse tree.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.Expression.#ctor(Proton.Lexer.Token)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a single token.
member.param: The token that represents the expression.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.Expression.ToCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the expression to its string representation for code generation.
member.param: Set the ident size of display.
member.returns: A string representation of the expression prefixed with "Exp:".

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.Expressions.IdentifierExpression
member.summary: Represents an identifier expression in the parse tree (e.g., variable names like "_varX").

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.IdentifierExpression.#ctor(Proton.Lexer.Token)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The token representing the identifier.
member.exception: Thrown if the token type is not .

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.IdentifierExpression.ToCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates the string representation of the identifier expression for code generation, including indentation and formatting.
member.param: The indentation level (each level equals 4 spaces).
member.returns: A formatted string representing the identifier.

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.Expressions.LiteralExpression
member.summary: Represents an literal expression in the parse tree (e.g., "abc", True/False, -2.34, 'c').

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.LiteralExpression.#ctor(Proton.Lexer.Token)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor checks that the token is of a valid literal type (UInt, Integer, Double, Char, Boolean or String).
member.param: The token representing the literal (UInt, Int, Double, Char, Bool or String).
member.exception: Thrown when the token type is not a valid literal type.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.LiteralExpression.ToCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates the string representation of the literal expression for code generation, including indentation and formatting.
member.param: The indentation level (each level equals 4 spaces).
member.returns: A formatted string representing the literal expression with indentation.

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.Expressions.SeparatorExpression
member.summary: Represents a separator expression, such as the colon ":" used in various syntax constructs.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.SeparatorExpression.#ctor(Proton.Lexer.Token)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Validates that the provided token is of type "Colon".
member.param: The token representing the separator (e.g., ":").
member.exception: Thrown if the token is not of type "Colon".

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.SeparatorExpression.ToCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates the string representation of the separator expression for code generation, applying the specified indentation.
member.param: The indentation level (each level equals 4 spaces).
member.returns: A formatted string representing the separator expression with indentation.

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.Expressions.TypeExpression
member.summary: Represents a type expression in the syntax tree, such as "N", "R", with support for detecting if it represents a list (e.g., "N[]").

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.TypeExpression.#ctor(Proton.Lexer.Token,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Validates that the provided token is a valid type token.
member.param: The type token (e.g., "N", "R").
Indicates whether the type is a list type (e.g., "N[]").
member.exception: Thrown if the token is not a recognized type token.

member.name: P:Proton.Parser.Expressions.TypeExpression.IsList
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the type represents a list (e.g., "N[]").

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.TypeExpression.ToCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates the string representation of the type expression for code generation, including a "[]" suffix if the type represents a list. Indentation is applied based on the specified level.
member.param: The indentation level (each level equals 4 spaces).
member.returns: A formatted string representing the type expression.

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.Expressions.TypeSpecifierExpression
member.summary: Represents a type specifier expression in the parse tree. A type specifier can be something like "N[]", "R", or "Z[]..". This class handles parsing and storing the list specifier and delimiters, as well as the type expression.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.TypeSpecifierExpression.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{Proton.Lexer.Token})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Parses the given tokens to extract type specifiers, list indicators, and delimiters.
member.param: The list of tokens to parse for the type specifier expression.
member.exception: Thrown when a critical parsing error occurs due to malformed or unexpected tokens.

member.name: P:Proton.Parser.Expressions.TypeSpecifierExpression.ListSpecifier
member.summary: Gets the list specifier for the type (e.g., "[]"). This token represents the square brackets used for array or list type specifications.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Expressions.TypeSpecifierExpression.ToCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates the string representation of the for code generation. Delegates to the base implementation to include the full structure of the type, including lists and delimiters, with appropriate indentation based on the provided level.
member.param: The indentation level.
member.returns: A formatted string representing the type specifier expression.

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.Interfaces.ISyntaxAnalyzer
member.summary: Defines the contract for a syntax analyzer responsible for validating tokenized sections, ensuring their proper syntactical structure, and collecting any syntax-related diagnostics.
member.remarks: This interface is typically used after lexical analysis to validate the syntax of the parsed code, ensuring that it adheres to the expected grammatical rules, and providing feedback for developers.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Interfaces.ISyntaxAnalyzer.Analyze(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Proton.Lexer.Token}})
member.summary: Analyzes the provided tokenized sections, checking for proper syntactical structure and identifying any syntax errors or warnings encountered during the analysis.
member.param: A dictionary containing tokenized input grouped by sections.
member.returns:
A containing:
Detected syntax errors and warnings
Validation result indicating whether the code is syntactically correct

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.ParseNode
member.summary: Represents a node in the parse tree used during syntax analysis. Each node may contain a single token or a list of tokens, and optional left and right child nodes.
member.remarks: Initializes a new instance of the class with a single token.
member.param: The token this node represents.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.#ctor(Proton.Lexer.Token)
member.summary: Represents a node in the parse tree used during syntax analysis. Each node may contain a single token or a list of tokens, and optional left and right child nodes.
member.remarks: Initializes a new instance of the class with a single token.
member.param: The token this node represents.

member.name: P:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.ParseSymbol
member.summary: Gets or sets the primary token represented by this parse tree node.

member.name: P:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.LeftNode
member.summary: Gets the left child node in the parse tree.

member.name: P:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.RightNode
member.summary: Gets the right child node in the parse tree.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.SetLeft(Proton.Parser.ParseNode)
member.summary: Sets the left child of this node. Can be overridden by derived classes.
member.param: The node to set as the left child.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.SetRight(Proton.Parser.ParseNode)
member.summary: Sets the right child of this node. Can be overridden by derived classes.
member.param: The node to set as the right child.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.ParseNode.ToCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the contents of the token list to a formatted code string.
member.param: Set the ident size of display.
member.returns: A string representation of the node's token values.

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.ParserResult
member.summary: Represents the result of parser analysis, including tokens, errors, and macro sections.
Represents the result of parser analysis, including tokens, errors, and macro sections.

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.Service.ParserService
member.summary: Provides a high-level orchestration service for syntax analysis, including parsing tokenized input and validating its structure.
member.remarks: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified syntax analyzer.
member.param: An instance of responsible for analyzing the tokenized sections.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Service.ParserService.#ctor(Proton.Parser.Interfaces.ISyntaxAnalyzer)
member.summary: Provides a high-level orchestration service for syntax analysis, including parsing tokenized input and validating its structure.
member.remarks: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified syntax analyzer.
member.param: An instance of responsible for analyzing the tokenized sections.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Service.ParserService.Complie(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Proton.Lexer.Token}})
member.summary: Performs the complete syntax analysis process on the provided tokenized sections. Analyzes the input sections for proper syntax, structural errors, and overall validity.
member.param: A dictionary containing tokenized input grouped by sections.
member.returns: A containing the result of the analysis, including any errors or warnings detected during parsing.

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.Statements.Statement
member.summary: Represents the base class for all statement nodes in the parse tree. A statement typically performs an action and does not return a value.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Statements.Statement.#ctor(Proton.Parser.Expressions.Expression)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a parsed expression.
member.param: The expression containing the parse symbol for this statement.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Statements.Statement.ToCode
member.summary: Converts the statement to its string representation for code generation.
member.returns: A string representation of the statement prefixed with "State:".

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.Statements.VariableDeclaration
member.summary: Represents a variable declaration statement in the parse tree. This includes a variable identifier, separator (like ":"), and type specifier (like "N[];"). (e.g., "_var1,_var2:N[]; or _var1:N or _var1:Z[];;").

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Statements.VariableDeclaration.#ctor(Proton.Parser.Expressions.IdentifierExpression,Proton.Parser.Expressions.SeparatorExpression,Proton.Parser.Expressions.TypeSpecifierExpression)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor processes the identifier, separator, and type specifier for the variable declaration.
member.param: The identifier expression for the variable.
The separator expression (e.g., ":").
The type specifier expression (e.g., "N[];").
member.exception: Thrown if there is an error in creating the variable declaration components.

member.name: P:Proton.Parser.Statements.VariableDeclaration.IsList
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the statement represents a list (e.g., "N[]").

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.Statements.VariableDeclaration.ToCode
member.summary: Converts the variable declaration statement to its string representation for code generation. This method formats the statement into a structured string, including the identifier, separator, and type.
member.returns: A string representation of the variable declaration statement.

member.name: T:Proton.Parser.SyntaxAnalyzer
member.summary: Represents the main parser class responsible for analyzing tokens from each macro section, generating syntax trees, and reporting errors and warnings.

member.name: P:Proton.Parser.SyntaxAnalyzer.CurrentToken
member.summary: Gets the current token at the parsing position, or EndOfInput if out of bounds.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.SyntaxAnalyzer.Reset
member.summary: Before starting a new syntax analysis, reset everything.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.SyntaxAnalyzer.StatePlaceParser
member.summary: Parses the StateSpace macro section, handling variable declarations.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.SyntaxAnalyzer.InputParser
member.summary: Parses the Input macro section, handling variable initialize.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.SyntaxAnalyzer.PreconditionParser
member.summary: Parses the Precondition macro section, handling variable initialize.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.SyntaxAnalyzer.PostconditionParser
member.summary: Parses the Postcondition macro section, handling variable initialize.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.SyntaxAnalyzer.Analyze(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Proton.Lexer.Token}})
member.summary: Analyzes the provided tokenized sections, validating their syntactical structure and identifying any syntax errors or warnings. It processes the input and returns the result of the syntax analysis, indicating whether the code conforms to the expected grammatical rules.
member.param: A dictionary containing tokenized input grouped by sections. Each section represents a logical unit of code, such as a function, loop, or declaration, with the tokens for that section organized in a list.
member.returns:
A containing:
– A list of syntax errors encountered during analysis.
– A list of non-critical syntax warnings that may need attention.
– A dictionary mapping macro section names to their associated parsed statements.
– A boolean indicating whether the analysis passed successfully without critical errors.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.SyntaxAnalyzer.SplitTokensByNewline(System.Collections.Generic.List{Proton.Lexer.Token})
member.summary: Splits a flat list of tokens into rows of tokens separated by newlines, removing whitespace and comment tokens.
member.param: The input token list.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.SyntaxAnalyzer.Eat(Proton.Lexer.Token,System.String)
member.summary: Consumes the current token and advances the token position. If the next token is null or marks the end of input unexpectedly, a warning is added.
member.param: The current token to be consumed.
The expected expression type following the current token.

member.name: M:Proton.Parser.SyntaxAnalyzer.PeekToken(System.Int32)
member.summary: Peeks ahead at a future token in the stream without advancing the current position.
member.param: The number of tokens to look ahead.
